meanings.definition: The greedy pursuit of wealth and material possessions.
meanings.sent1: Her mammonism led her to prioritize money over relationships.
meanings.sent2: In today's society, mammonism often overshadows values like kindness and generosity.
meanings.sent3: His mammonism was so extreme that he even tried to buy friends with expensive gifts.
meanings.sent4: The mammonism of the corporation was evident in their relentless pursuit of profits above all else.
meanings.sent5: The allure of mammonism can blind people to the true treasures of life.

meanings.definition: The belief that money and material wealth are the most important things in life.
meanings.sent1: Their mammonism made them view success solely in terms of financial gain.
meanings.sent2: Mammonism can lead individuals to sacrifice their happiness for the pursuit of riches.
meanings.sent3: The family's mammonism was so extreme that they even argued over who had the most expensive car.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, mammonism often influences decision-making more than public welfare.
meanings.sent5: The grip of mammonism can make people forget the true value of relationships and experiences.
